pages.title: Edwardsiphyton
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Ordovician$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Near water$(br2)$(l)Propagation:$() $(l:basics/collecting_plants)Spore-bearing plants$(/l)$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Shears

Edwardsiphyton and Dollyphyton are somewhat contentious fossils found in the Douglas Lake Member of the Lenoir Limestone. The fossil impressions are not easy to interpret but Edwardsiphyton resembles some modern hummock-forming mosses.
